greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Write n = C(i,2)+C(j,1) with i>j>=0; let L[n] = [i,j]; sequence gives list of pairs L[n], n >= 0.
comment: Each n >= 0 has a unique representation as n = C(i,2)+C(j,1) with i>j>=0. This is the combinatorial number system of degree t = 2. The i values are A002024, the j values A002262.
reference: D. E. Knuth, The Art of Computer Programming, vol. 4A, Combinatorial Algorithms, Section 7.2.1.3, Eq. (20), p. 360.
example: The pairs L[0] through L[10] are
mathematica: A138036list[len_] := Module[{i = 0, j = 1, L = {1, 0}}, Do[i++; If[i == j, j++; i = 0]; AppendTo[L, j]; AppendTo[L, i], {len}]; L];
xref: Cf. A002024, A002262. See A194847 for degree t=3.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 04 2011
